iati-activity.description: Strengthening climate information and early warning systems in Western and Central Africa for climate resilient development and adaptation to climate change â SÃ£o TomÃ© and PrÃ­ncipe

iati-activity.title: PIMS5103-Strengthening Climate
iati-activity.description: PIMS 5103-STRENGTHENING CLIMATES

country-budget-items.budget-item: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

result.title: Objective
result.description: To strengthen the climate monitoring capabilities, early warning systems and available information for responding to climate shocks and planning adaptation to climate change in SÃ£o TomÃ© and Principe

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1.Capacity as per capacity assessment scorecard
2.Domestic finance committed to the relevant institutions to monitor extreme weather and climate change

baseline.comment:
1.Limited capacity to generate EWS and CI on a national scale for extreme hydro-meteorological phenomena
Limited disaster risk prevention capacity on local levels within CONPREC - CP
No Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for alert communication by CONPREC - CP with the support of NGOs/CSOs
Current score: 22
2.Existing budget plans do not have sufficient funds to maintain and operate environmental monitoring infrastructure
Current budget: $500,000

target.comment:
1. Capacity assessment Target score 161 for all combined EWS agencies
2. 30% increase in domestic financing for equipment operation and maintenance across all institutions

actual.comment:
A contest was launched and a company was selected to provide hydrometeorological equipment. The process was evaluated at the regional level.
A working meeting with telecommunications companies was organized. So far just CST (Santomean Company of telecommunication) met with us and we are still waiting for another meeting to happen with UNITEL - ST.
A field visit to the district level was made and 10 new local committees for risk management and disasters have been created.
Training of 26 journalists and 3 meteorological technicians in "Environmental Journalism and disaster risk management" through the South / South cooperation. Training of 44 technicians from district chambers, regional government and NGOs on "Capacity Building of Local and Regional Authorities in the Implementation of Programs and Development Projects".

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Enhanced capacity of national hydro-meteorological (NHMS) and environmental institutions to monitor extreme weather and climate change

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1.% national coverage of climate/weather and hydrological monitoring infrastructure
2.Frequency and timeliness of climate-related data availability

baseline.comment:
1.Currently, there is less than 20 % national coverage for climate/weather monitoring with respect to the optimal arrangements defined in NIM/DGRNE feasibility reports and WMO standards.
Baseline is 7 AWS, 2 Automatic water level stations and 58 manual synoptic/ agro/ hydrometric stations needing upgrades.
2.Data from manual weather and hydrological stations is collected monthly and transmitted by post.

target.comment:
1. Increase to 60 % national coverage to take steps in achieving NHMS optimal monitoring arrangements as defined in feasibility studies.
Target: 31 AWS, 14 automatic water level stations and 58 manual synoptic/ agro/ hydrometric stations upgraded.
2. Target for data transmission frequency: daily.

actual.comment:
Recruitment of a consultant to assess the acquisition and installation of a lightning detection system based on the updated system under SINERGIA.
Recruitment of a national consultant to make the baseline of the meteorological and hydrological sector and all the others partner involved in this project.
Elaboration of a training plan for meteorologists and meteorological observers, hydrologists and hydrological observers. International and regional institutions have been contacted for the training of meteorologists and hydrologists. We have already selected the candidates and we are waiting for the last confirmations from universities to send the students.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Efficient and effective use of hydro-meteorological and environmental information for making early warnings and long-term development plans.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
1.% of population with access to improved climate information and flood, drought, strong wind and coastal warnings (disaggregated by gender).
2. GoSTP Development Plans and land-use plans at National/ District that integrate climate information in their formulation of poverty reduction strategies and links between poverty and the environment at local levels.
3.Sector-specific EW products and strategies that integrate climate risks in fisheries, tourism and land management sectors).

baseline.comment:
1. There are existing EWS initiatives for regional drought and famine alerts; however, a national alert system concerned with extreme hydro-meteorological phenomena is not available. There is a limited understanding of technical alert jargon (alerts are not translated into national languages). No mechanism exists for most vulnerable populations to be involved in the alert process to ensure its sustainability.
Current access to warnings: 30% men, 20% women.
2.Development frameworks do not incorporate any EWS/CI products such as risk maps or climate change predictions into long-term planning.
Current score: 0
3. Sector specific strategies do not include EWS/CI because the quality of weather forecasts and climate predictions is poor and not tailored for specific uses, particularly seasonal forecasts.
Current score: 0

target.comment:
1. Increase to 50% for both men and women who have access to improved EWS/CI.
Target: 50% men; 50% women
2. At least 2 of the PRSP policy briefs incorporate analyses of risk maps and/or climate change projections influencing long-term planning proposals (at least 1 national and 1 district plan).
Target score: 2
3. Development of at least 2 tailored climate products and presentation of a market research plan on how to implement mobile phone based fishing and agricultural advisories, both supporting targeted weather/climate service delivery.
Target score: 2

actual.comment:
Creation of the terms of reference to select 10 meteorological observers.
The project was presented in the Autonomous Region of Principe, to the Regional President of the government, Regional Secretary of Infrastructure and the Regional Direction of Meteorology and Natural Resources and Energy.
Identification of hydrologic and meteorological resources in the Autonomous Region
It is scheduled for next year to undergo the acquisition of the proper ways to transfer data and give the possibility to share real-time climate information with fisherman and farmers using SMS.
It is also planned to launch a ToR to recruit a national consultant to make the inventory of all the possible private buyers for meteorological information and the establishment of partnerships with them.
A local committee for natural disasters and risk management with a proper training plan was created.
